nodes.bodyText: Rather than patching up inconsistant hex notation, would it be better to address it in the source?  Are we generating bad results?  Is this input filtering?  IMHO standard APIs should have one mapping to each value, and allowing multiple mappings (with 0x, without 0x) is a common source of bugs.
Bytes.toShortHexString returns 0x for a byte array containing only zeros. However this API output requires a 0x0 instead. So what do you suggest ? Not using this method ?

I put a TODO in the code with a link to Tuweni bug.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TUWENI-31
